defs: = ಬೆಡಗಿ.
a handsome, charming man.
a man who is excessively vain and concerned about his dress, appearance, and manners; a fop.
a man over indulged in sexual enjoyments.

brightness, brilliance; splendour.

beauty; charm.
a lamp, as a source of light.

= ಬೆಣಚು.

one of the commonest minerals, silicon dioxide, SiO2 , having many varieties that differ in colour, lustre, etc., and occurring either in masses (as agate, bloodstone, chalcedony, jasper, etc.) or in crystals (as rock crystal, amethyst, citrine, etc.); quartz.

= ಬೆಣಚು.

very white rice.

the solid, yellowish, edible fat that results from churning cream or whole milk; butter.
anything that is very soft, usu. white in colour.

ಬೆಣ್ಣೆ ಚಾವಡಿ beṇṇe cāvaḍi one of the eighteen offices in the erstwhile Maisuru government, that would be in charge of dairy produts, caring of livestock, etc.; ಒಂದು ಕಣ್ಣಿಗೆ ಬೆಣ್ಣೆ, ಒಂದು ಕಣ್ಣಿಗೆ ಸುಣ್ಣ ondu kaṇṇige beṇṇe, ondu kiaṇṇige suṇṇa to show undue partiality to or favour someone unduly, at the cost of another; to make fish of one and flesh of another; ಬೆಣ್ಣೆಯಲ್ಲಿ ಕೂದಲು ತೆಗೆ beṇṇeyalli kūdalu tege to solve the problems very easily, without hurting the people involved; 2. to do (anything) very smoothly; 3. to talk in a very smooth, intimate and plausible manner; ಬೆಣ್ಣೆ ಹಚ್ಚು beṇṇe haccu to persuade by flattery or bribery; to cajole.
the grass Bracharia ramasoa of Poaceae family.
a thin, soft white or lightly creamy paper.
a kind of sweet pudding, made using butter.

another plant Sida rhombifolia ( = S. canariensis) of the same family.
a kind of bird.

ಬೆನ್ನು ತಟ್ಟು bennu taṭṭu = ಬೆನ್ನು ಚಪ್ಪರಿಸು; ಬೆನ್ನ ಹಿಂದೆ ಇರು benna hinde iru to provide support from behind or indirectly; ಬೆನ್ನು ಚಪ್ಪರಿಸು bennu capparisu to inspire with courage, spirit or confidence; to encourge; ಬೆನ್ನು ತಿರುಗಿಸು bennu tirugisu to turn or run away from; to shun one's responsibility; ಬೆನ್ನು ತೋರಿಸು bennu tōrisu = ಬೆನ್ನು ತಿರುಗಿಸು; ಬೆನ್ನು ಹಾಕು bennu hāku to turn away from;ಬೆನ್ನು ಹೊಟ್ಟೆ ಒಂದಾಗು bennu hoṭṭe ondāgu to starve utterly;ಬೆನ್ನ ಬಿಡು benna biḍu to stop supporting (another from behind); ತನ್ನ ಬೆನ್ನನ್ನು ತಾನೇ ತಟ್ಟಿಕೊ tanna bennannu tānē taṭṭiko to praise oneself; ತನ್ನ ಬೆನ್ನು ತನಗೆ ಕಾಣದಿರು tanna bennu tanage kāṇadiru (one's own mistakes, shortcomings, etc.) not to be recognised or realised by oneself; the eye that sees all things does see itself; ಬೆನ್ನು ತೋರು bennu tōru = ಬೆನ್ನು ತಿರುಗಿಸು; ಬೆನ್ನ ಹಿಂದೆ benna hinde in one's absence; ಬೆನ್ನು ಹಿಡಿ behhu hiḍi to follow; to go behind.
